physical_appearance: This is an exercise book. The cover is brown in colour, and does not have any inscriptions written on it. The edges of the exercise book are slightly worn out and folded, especially along the corners.
sgcool_label_text: This Malay-English dictionary written in pencil in old exercise book is an artefact that represents how P.O.Ws adapted to their language environment and gives an insight into everyday life for a P.O.W at Changi. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Manuscript Malay-English dictionary written in pencil in old exercise book
subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war documents (object genre) handwriting notebooks
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Writing Notebooks
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
